posts.title: Rockette, Karilyn Suratt, Shares Her Excitement About Being One of Norwegian Breakaway’s Godmothers
posts.title_plain: Rockette, Karilyn Suratt, Shares Her Excitement About Being One of Norwegian Breakaway’s Godmothers
posts.content:
My excitement for the Rockettes and Norwegian Cruise Line’s partnership is like that of a kid waiting for Santa on Christmas Day!  The Rockettes are the official Godmothers to Norwegian Cruise Line’s newest ship Norwegian Breakaway.  What an honor!  Not only are we celebrating 85years of the Rockettes in New York City, we are celebrating our partnership with Norwegian Cruise Line on their largest ship to homeport in New York City year-round.  Being on board Norwegian Gem for the announcement was my first time on a cruise ship, and I cannot wait for Norwegian Breakaway’s first voyage to set sail.

As part of our role as Godmothers, the Rockettes will sail on Norwegian Breakaway’s first six voyages, and on the first cruise of each month thereafter.  Having met guests and crew on board Norwegian Gem, I am looking forward to the special events we will get to be a part of on board Norwegian Breakaway.  We will showcase our athleticism and precision technique with various offerings including a historical retrospective in the ship’s library.  That’s right, library, where I might be found perusing the shelves in between some of the exclusive fitness classes designed by Rockettes for Norwegian Breakaway’s guests.  There will even be featured beverages, photo opportunities, meet and greet speaker series and so much more!  And, on select sailings, guests will have the exclusive opportunity to meet two of the legendary Rockettes – truly a unique experience for Norwegian Cruise Line guests. 

From the moment we arrived at Pier 88 through our entire visit, the crew and front of house staff were phenomenal.  Their camaraderie and enthusiasm is so great that I have no doubt the Rockettes will fit right in on Norwegian Breakaway, figuratively and literally. I can only imagine how the accommodations will be on board Norwegian Breakaway after the spectacular service we experienced today.  And believe me, the Rockettes know spectacular. 

When it was time to go back to Radio City Music Hall, there wasn’t a single one of us who wasn’t wishing it was already next May when we will be able to experience a unique, time of our lives voyage on Norwegian Breakaway.  With its New York City theme, it will be our perfect home away from home.

As your Norwegian Breakaway Godmothers we will stay dedicated to inspiring you all and will keep dreaming big as this year we celebrate our 85 years of performing in New York and our exciting partnership with Norwegian Cruise Line.  We believe that together we are better!  Be sure to keep in touch with us on Facebook and Twitter to see what your Rockette Godmothers are up to.

Can’t wait to see you on board!

-Karilyn (pictured all the way to the right in the photo above)

attachments.title: New York Icons The Rockettes Named Godmothers of Norwegian Breakaway
attachments.description:
-New York, NY -Norwegian Cruise Line and MSG Entertainment announced today that the Rockettes will christen Norwegian Breakaway as the official Godmothers. The christening will take place in New York City on May 8th 2013 on board the Norwegian Breakaway . The Rockettes L-R Christina Hedrick,Corrine Thghe,Afra Hines,Christine Sienicki,Lori Barber and Karilyn Swratt .

-PICTURED: The Rockettes(Christina Hedrick,Corrine Thghe,Afra Hines,Christine Sienicki,Lori Barber,Karilyn Swratt)

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway’s Bridge
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway’s Bridge
posts.content: This amazing photo shows the construction of one of the most important pieces of Norwegian Breakaway, the ship’s bridge. The bridge “block” will be the very last block to be lifted on to the top of the ship.
posts.excerpt: This amazing photo shows the construction of one of the most important pieces of Norwegian Breakaway, the ship’s bridge. The bridge “block” will be the very last block to be lifted on to the top of the ship.

posts.title: Peter Max Beams with Pride and Excitement Describing the “Playfulness” of Norwegian Breakaway’s Hull Art
posts.title_plain: Peter Max Beams with Pride and Excitement Describing the “Playfulness” of Norwegian Breakaway’s Hull Art
posts.content:
Painting the hull of a ship as massive as Norwegian Breakaway is a dream that Peter Max says, “I would have never even dared to dream.”  As a young boy, Max traveled the world with his family by boat and formed a deep personal connection with the ocean; therefore, he says the opportunity to showcase his work on the side of a massive cruise ship is “truly unbelievable.”

Prior to discovering his love of art, Max’s first passion was a love of the universe, planets and the solar system. It wasn’t until one of his childhood nannies taught him how to draw that he began experimenting with sketches and colors – a talent he quickly discovered came very naturally. As a result, he abandoned his original plan of becoming an astronomer to pursue a career in art, but pays homage to his first love by including the planets and solar system in much of his work, including Norwegian Breakaway.

Max says that when designing the hull of Norwegian Breakaway, he channeled his inner child to create a playful original piece that represents his past, his passions and New York City, his favorite city on Earth. Max was “filled with glee, and went out of his mind with excitement,” when he heard that Norwegian Breakaway would call New York City home. His deep connection and passion for the city goes beyond just being a resident. He has painted his signature Statue of Liberty design, another element included in the design for Norwegian Breakaway, for every United States President since Ronald Regan. And it was his original Statue of Liberty drawing for President Regan that led Max to lead the $375 million Statue of Liberty renovation project that culminated in 1982.

Max says he cannot wait to sail on board Norwegian Breakaway when she arrives to New York City in May 2013. He wishes he could hop on board, “my baby,” every weekend because he says “this is a ship who’s hull embodies the history of my life and all of my dreams.” When asked how he will feel the first time he sees Norwegian Breakaway sail down the Hudson River he replied, “I live on the west side of Manhattan, so I will have a front row seat, and I imagine I will be so overwhelmed that I might jump out and swim after it.”

Max has created many incredible works of art including a Boeing 777 for Continental Airlines, a US Postage Stamp and a mile-long stage at Woodstock, but considers Norwegian Breakaway his most exciting and rewarding work yet. He expresses deep gratitude and appreciation to Norwegian for giving him this “beyond incredible opportunity.”
posts.excerpt: Painting the hull of a ship as massive as Norwegian Breakaway is a dream that Peter Max says, “I would have never even dared to dream.”  As a young boy, Max traveled the world with his family by boat and formed a deep personal connection with [...]

posts.title: The Aft of Norwegian Breakaway is Revealed!

posts.content: This photo showing the newly-built aft section of Norwegian Breakaway is truly spectacular. Using their patented state of the art assembly processes and equipment, the team at Meyer Werft (meyerwerft.com) is building Norwegian Breakaway in record time! Seeing this photo is an exciting reminder that the delivery of Norwegian’s newest and most innovative ship is right around the corner!

posts.title: New Blocks are Transported to the Yard
posts.title_plain: New Blocks are Transported to the Yard
posts.content: One of Norwegian Breakaway’s bottom blocks is on its way to Meyer Werft shipyard. The yard is located in Papenburg, Germany and this giant bottom section of the ship is being transported to the yard in via the Baltic Sea with support of two tug boats.
posts.excerpt: One of Norwegian Breakaway’s bottom blocks is on its way to Meyer Werft shipyard. The yard is located in Papenburg, Germany and this giant bottom section of the ship is being transported to the yard in via the Baltic Sea with support of two tug boats.

attachments.title: New blocks are transported to ship yard

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway’s Funnel is Placed!
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway’s Funnel is Placed!
posts.content:
Despite the extremely tight squeeze, the team at Meyer Werft was able to maneuver their largest crane to carefully and precisely place the signature funnel on top of Norwegian Breakaway! Now that the funnel is in place, only a few centimeters separate the ship from the top of the ship yard in which it is being built.

Here are some fun facts about the ship’s new funnel:

Weight:  85 tons

Length: 18 Meters

Height: 13 Meters

Breadth: 9 Meters

Material: Aluminum

Norwegian Breakaway’s new funnel and the tight squeeze can be seen in the following photos taken at the yard today!

Now that the funnel is in place, only a few centimeters separate the ship from the top of the ship yard in which it is [...]

posts.title: Blog Entry from Norwegian Breakaway’s Celebrity Chef, Geoffrey Zakarian!
posts.title_plain: Blog Entry from Norwegian Breakaway’s Celebrity Chef, Geoffrey Zakarian!
posts.content:
I am so thrilled to have announced my partnership with Norwegian Cruise Line.  I have always wanted to create a restaurant with a defined focus on seafood that incorporates techniques to pull flavors from fish.  Truly, I feel that I need to pinch myself – superb partners in a pristine setting aboard Norwegian’s pinnacle – and most innovative ship!

 We have been working hard to start formulating the Ocean Blue dining space.  Chairs and barstools have been selected as well as fabrics.   We worked quickly with a genius graphics firm to come up with a logo aesthetic that will start to shape the restaurant’s personality.  I have started putting together a list of all my best purveyors so my choice ingredients will be available for us to cook with on board.   We are crafting a true New York restaurant for this incredible ship!

And as luck would have it, we were able to tour both Norwegian Epic and Norwegian Star.  I was struck by the immaculate nature of both ships. I was in awe that as we toured the ships, 3000 guests had just gotten off and 3,000 more were due back on in just two hours!  Not to mention that the kitchens were enormous, and the storage for everything amazingly organized.  I have to say, I was most impressed by the bakery – astonishingly, the bakeries on board produce every single baked good that is served to guests.

I was also very impressed by each of the ship’s Hotel Directors. They truly manage floating cities, and their front of house and back of house staff couldn’t have been more hospitable. Bottom line, the facilities were fist rate all around. 

I will check back in soon with all of you Norwegian Breakaway fans and provide updates to you on the progress of my new restaurants, Ocean Blue, The Raw Bar and Ocean Blue on The Waterfront.  In the meantime, feel free to chat with me on twitter at @GZChef.  

See you on board soon ~  Geoffrey

posts.title: Rockin’ Entertainment On Board Breakaway
posts.title_plain: Rockin’ Entertainment On Board Breakaway
posts.content:
Our latest Norwegian Breakaway announcement confirms that Norwegian Breakaway will be jam packed with unbelievable entertainment! Whether guests are looking to attend a rock your socks off of main stage show, a spectacular dance performance, an awe-inspiring cirque spectacular, a soulful blues performance, an interactive rock n roll piano experience, or laugh out loud comedy, they are guaranteed to find constant entertainment on board Norwegian Breakaway.

It is official; Breakaway Theater will be home to the five-time Tony Award nominated musical ROCK OF AGES, one of the longest running shows in Broadway history! This classic rock love story has been hailed as Broadway’s best party because it is chock-full of everyone’s favorite sing a long classic rock tunes, from “Every Rose Has Its Thorn,” to “I Wanna Know What Love Is,” to “Here I Go Again,” to “Don’t Stop Believin,” and more. The energy in the theater will be contagious as audience members channel their inner rock star, sing along and dance from the beginning to end of this world-renowned show!

Everyone, from hard core dance fans to those who are new to dance, are dazzled by BURN THE FLOOR, otherwise known as Ballroom “supercharged.”  Prepare to witness expert dancers perform every kind of Ballroom dance form, including The Waltz, Cha Cha, Samba, Salsa, Rumba, Foxtrot, Quickstep, Mambo, Tango, Swing, Jive, Lindy Hop, Viennese Waltz, and Paso Doble, to an array of music selections from Swing and Waltz classics to J-Lo and Credence Clearwater. The show made its debut back in London in 1999, toured around the United States, even performing in Radio City Music Hall, continued on to tour worldwide before premiering on Broadway in 2009, and now Breakaway Theater and The Manhattan Room on Norwegian Breakaway can be added to the show’s impressive resume!

Those who have sailed on Norwegian Epic, and had a chance to attend Cirque Dreams & Dinner can attest to how mesmerizing and powerful this experience is. The circus feats that the acrobats perform are mind-blowing, but when you are reminded that they are performing them on a moving ship – it becomes unbelievable. On Norwegian Breakaway, the Spiegel Tent will feature another spectacular dinner show – An adaptation of the Broadway show CIRQUE DREAMS JUNGLE FANTASY, created by famed producer/director Neil Goldberg. This jungle-themed dinner show will feature the Cirque Dreamers performing their breathtaking feats surrounded by a soaring Ballet of Butterflies, Flipping Monkeys, Hopping Frogs, Spine-bending Lizards and Fanciful Birds in an exotic, awe-inspiring adventure.The show originally debuted in Vegas and was hailed as “the grandest circus spectacle east of Vegas” by New York Magazine. It then debuted at the Broadway Theatre in 2008 and remains only show of its kind to ever perform on Broadway, and now guests on board Norwegian Breakaway can experience it as well.

New York’s very own Slam Allen made a name for himself when he headlined the house band in the Jazz & Blues Club on Norwegian Epic, and now he will return to center stage in Fat Cats Jazz & Blues Club on Norwegian Breakaway.  Blowing audiences away with his soulfully intense blues and jazz performances, Slam has been entertaining audiences for over 20 years. Guests can sit back and relax in one of the comfortable leather chairs or couches of this hipster-inspired space, while whales away – pouring his heart and soul into every single song. And, only on Norwegian Breakaway, can guests also enjoy his smooth sounds while sitting on The Waterfront, with a drink in hand, taking in the warm ocean breeze.

There will be no shortage of laughs on board Norwegian Breakaway because the hilarious improvisational comedy of The Second City is back to perform more of their side-splitting satires, songs and improvisational comedy in Headliners. The Second City is not your average comedy troupe – they are comedy heavyweights and have an impressive resume, as it has it has spawned some of the biggest legends of comedy including, Bill Murray, Chris Farley, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Gilda Radner, John Belushi, Tina Fey, Steve Carell and Jason Sudeikis. So, when attending one of The Second City Shows, guests on board Norwegian Breakaway might just be witnessing another comedy legend in the making.

Sharing the Headliner’s stage is Howl at the Moon, the world’s greatest rock n’ roll dueling piano show, Guests who attend this interactive show should not only prepare to be entertained, they should also get ready to become part of the show. The Howl at the Moon entertainment experience received rave reviews on Norwegian Epic, and is destined to do the same on board Norwegian Breakaway as it will also feature talented piano players seated behind two baby grand pianos, surrounded by guests who are ready to sing along to all of their favorite songs – from 70’s rock to hip-hop – bottom line – get ready to clap, sing, dance and howl!

posts.title: Block 45 is Placed in the Dock
posts.title_plain: Block 45 is Placed in the Dock
posts.content: Yesterday at Meyer Werft, block number 45 of Norwegian Breakaway was lifted into place. This block comprises a key element of Norwegian Breakaway’s public areas, the ship’s central staircase. Once placed, the staircase will connect decks six and seven, of 678 Oceanplace, two of Norwegian Breakaway’s main public decks. The future location of the stairs will be in the “cut-out” area, easily identified at the top of the deck, in the photo below.

posts.title: First Piece of Steel is Cut for Norwegian Getaway!
posts.title_plain: First Piece of Steel is Cut for Norwegian Getaway!
posts.content: Norwegian Cruise Line and Meyer Werft executives had another ground-breaking event to cheer about on Friday, May 4, 2012 when they watched as the first piece of steel was cut for the construction of Norwegian Getaway. A plasma torch was used to cut the important first plate of steel in the yard’s state-of-the-art laser center in Papenburg, Germany. This piece is significant because it marks the beginning of the ship’s construction and will become part of Block 40 of Norwegian Getaway. Set to join the Norwegian fleet in 2014, Norwegian Getaway will homeport in Miami, year-round, giving guests the perfect opportunity to “Getaway” from their busy lives, routines, school, and daily stress for the cruise vacation of a lifetime. During his remarks, Kevin Sheehan, CEO of Norwegian Cruise Line stated, “Cutting the first piece of steel for Norwegian Getaway takes us one step closer to having this ship join our fleet in 2014 and begin sailing year-round from Miami, the cruise capital of the world.” Mr. Bernard Meyer, Managing Director at Meyer Werft, also addressed the crowd, expressing his excitement for the arrival of Norwegian Getaway and the pride he has for the ship yard and their partnership with Norwegian Cruise Line. At the close of the ceremony, each attendee was given a small piece of steel, as a memento for their participation in this exciting milestone.
posts.excerpt: Norwegian Cruise Line and Meyer Werft executives had another ground-breaking event to cheer about on Friday, May 4, 2012 when they watched as the first piece of steel was cut for the construction of Norwegian Getaway. A plasma torch was used to cut the important first plate of steel in the yard’s state-of-the-art laser center [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway’s Keel is Laid
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway’s Keel is Laid
posts.content: On Friday, May 4, 2012, Norwegian Cruise Line and Meyer Werft executives cheered as Kevin Sheehan, Norwegian Cruise Line’s chief executive officer, laid the traditional “lucky coin,” and watched as the first 350-ton block of Norwegian Breakaway was lifted and set into place by an 800-ton crane. The exciting Keel Laying ceremony took place at Meyer Werft in Papenburg, Germany and many members of Norwegian’s Executive Team, including Michael Flesch, Senior Vice President of Hotel Operations; Mark Kansley, Vice President of Hotel Operations; Arturo Guerrero, Vice President of Newbuild and Refurbishment; Richard Ambrose, Vice President of Entertainment and Howard Flanders, Senior Vice President of Finance and Treasury, flew to Germany to witness this historic event. Friday’s ceremony marks a major milestone in the building of Norwegian’s newest ship – the start of block assembly. Throughout the building process, a total of 73 enormous blocks will be used to form the structure of the ship. During his remarks, Bernard Meyer, managing director of Meyer Werft, discussed how Norwegian Breakaway is the first ship to ever be built using their brand new, more efficient construction process.  The proprietary new system will allow the yard to deliver the more than 140,0000 ton ship – the yard’s largest ship, ever – in less than 12 months, an incredible feat in the ship building industry. “The anticipation is building for this incredible ship,” said Kevin Sheehan. “It’s thrilling to mark the start of the block assembly and realize that in one year we will take delivery of Norwegian Breakaway.  We can’t wait.” Kevin also expressed his sincere pride and appreciation for Norwegian’s New Build Team, led by Christer Karlsson, Vice President of New Build, and the dedicated, hardworking team at  Meyer Werft. At the close of the ceremony, Mr. Bernard Meyer led the group of Norwegian and ship yard executives in a champagne toast to Norwegian Breakaway and echoed Kevin’s praise of the partnership between the ship yard and Norwegian Cruise Line.
posts.excerpt: On Friday, May 4, 2012, Norwegian Cruise Line and Meyer Werft executives cheered as Kevin Sheehan, Norwegian Cruise Line’s chief executive officer, laid the traditional “lucky coin,” and watched as the first 350-ton block of Norwegian Breakaway was lifted and set into place by an 800-ton crane. The exciting Keel Laying ceremony took place at [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway Takes Recreation and Outdoor Fun to New Heights
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway Takes Recreation and Outdoor Fun to New Heights
posts.content:
Today, Norwegian Cruise Line made another big splash by unveiling Norwegian Breakaway’s ground-breaking recreation and outdoor spaces. Norwegian Breakaway will feature an unparalleled multi-story Aqua Park and will be the only ship in the world to feature five full-size water slides. This high-thrill, incredible aqua park will be Norwegian’s largest ever and home to the first-ever twin Free Fall slides at sea, also the fastest slides at sea. As riders stand up in the chute, the floor will abruptly drop from underneath, propelling them into a thrilling loop. The Whip, two additional side-by-side twister slides, will give guests the ultimate adrenaline rush – as they plunge through a two-story spiral in a race to the finish line. For families, the park will also feature an open-flume body slide. And for those who wish to just chill out can do so in one of the two main pools, four hot tubs or at Breezeway Bar & Grill, a semi-open air eatery, serving up delicious pool-side favorites.

Norwegian Breakaway’s spectacular sports complex was also designed with sports enthusiasts and adventure-seekers in mind. Spanning three stories, it will be Norwegian’s largest sports complex by far, and offer guests the ultimate challenge on the largest ropes course at sea. Here, guests will enjoy testing their endurance as they meander through each of the course’s 40 different elements. Guests will also be challenged to hang on tight as they whizz along the zip track, and be dared not to hold their breath as they walk out along The Plank. Extending eight feet over the side of the ship, The Plank will give guests the opportunity to test their mettle as they step out on to the narrow platform, looking down at the water below! As if that wasn’t enough excitement, the complex also includes a special ropes course for children, a nine-hole ocean-themed miniature golf course, a three-story rock climbing wall, bungee trampoline and spider web, a 24-foot enclosed climbing cage with a spiral slide.

Children will also have a blast splashing around in the Nickelodeon themed Kids’ Aqua Park surrounded by statues of their favorite, whimsical and larger than life Nickelodeon characters, including SpongeBob SquarePants, Patrick, Squidward and more. Family-favorite Nickelodeon Programming is also back on Norwegian Breakaway, including the all-new Pajama Jam Character Breakfast, Dora’s Dance Party, Nickelodeon Character Meet and Greets, Story Time with Dora, Nickelodeon Arts and Crafts and more. Splash Academy, the ship’s two-story youth area, will also feature Nickelodeon characters and activities.

Also revealed today was Spice H2O, the ultimate adult-only enclave. The combination of comfortable sun loungers, a huge video screen, two hot tubs and a soothing waterfall feature (perfect for cooling off from the sun) will make Spice H20 the ideal destination for daytime relaxation. When the sun goes down, Spice H20 will transform into a night time hot spot where guests can dance under the stars, chill out at bar or lounge area, while admiring the ocean views. Vibe Beach Club is another adults-only hot spot. This exclusive beach club will be the perfect place to relax, unwind, soak up the sun and enjoy a refreshing drink from the bar.

Back by popular demand, Garden Café, Norwegian’s action-station restaurant will also be found on board Norwegian Breakaway and will offer guests an abundant assortment of delicious menu items for breakfast, lunch and dinner. No matter what they are craving – guests will find it here and enjoy watching the skilled chefs at each station prepare a wide variety of fresh, made-to-order dishes, including seafood, pizza, fruit, soups, pasta, ethnic specialties, burgers, desserts and more.

This high-thrill, incredible aqua park will be Norwegian’s largest ever and home to the [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Getaway to Homeport in Miami Year-Round
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Getaway to Homeport in Miami Year-Round
posts.content: Today, Norwegian announced that Norwegian Getaway will make PortMiami her year-round home port, making her the largest ship ever to home port year-round in Miami. Norwegian Getaway will sail weekly cruises beginning in the spring of 2014. Miami-Dade County officials joined Norwegian Cruise Line Chief Executive Officer Kevin Sheehan at PortMiami onboard Norwegian Spirit for this exciting announcement. “Miami has been the home of this Company since our beginning in 1966. Therefore, we are so excited to bring one of our two new Breakaway-class ships here to Miami to homeport year-round,” said Kevin Sheehan. “Norwegian Getaway will embrace all that the Magic City has to offer and will offer an extraordinary cruise experience to the more than 4,000 guests who will sail on her each week beginning in spring 2014.”
posts.excerpt: Today, Norwegian announced that Norwegian Getaway will make PortMiami her year-round home port, making her the largest ship ever to home port year-round in Miami. Norwegian Getaway will sail weekly cruises beginning in the spring of 2014. Miami-Dade County officials joined Norwegian Cruise Line Chief Executive Officer Kevin Sheehan at PortMiami onboard Norwegian Spirit for [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Unveils Norwegain Breakaway’s Youth & Teen Spaces and Names for New Programs
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Unveils Norwegain Breakaway’s Youth & Teen Spaces and Names for New Programs
posts.content:
On March 22, 2012, Norwegian Breakaway’s youth and teen spaces were unveiled at an event held in partnership with Conde Nast Traveler. Close to 100 hundred travel partners and media were in attendance, along with Norwegian’s CEO Kevin Sheehan, Executive Vice President of Global Sales, Andy Stuart, and Senior Vice President of Marketing, Maria Miller.

At the event, Norwegian revealed the new names for the fleetwide youth and teen programs, which were ch

osen through the line’s Up2U naming contest. “Splash Academy” is the new name for the enhanced youth program and “Entourage” is the new moniker for the revitalized teen program. Names were also selected for the four age groups within the youth program: Guppies for ages 2 and under; Turtles for ages 3 to 5; Seals for ages 6 to 9; and Dolphins for ages 10 to 12.

Norwegian also revealed that Norwegian Breakaway will debut the largest youth and teen dedicated facilities in the fleet. For the first time, the youth area, Splash Academy, will feature areas designed specifically for three specific age groups and will span two decks. It will also be conveniently located adjacent to Norwegian Breakaway’s family-friendly staterooms. Teens will have a dedicated space called Entourage, located at the top of the ship on Deck 16.  Babies and toddlers under age three, along with their parents, will also have their own dedicated play space with activities.

The highlight of the event was when Kevin Sheehan was grilled about the new program by 10-year-old Charlie, son of Conde Nast Traveler Consumer Travel Editor Wendy Perrin. She is a fan of Norwegian and had recently sailed on Norwegian Star.  Her son, a fan of Norwegian’s former youth program, interviewed Kevin about the offerings in the new program. Charlie’s brother, Doug, 8, also joined in when he helped a clown from Hilario Productions with some special circus acts. Hilario Productions will be providing circus classes on board as part of the enhanced program. Special thanks to Brenn, Gina and Chris from Hilario for their performances during the event.

Check out the family video montage showing the new program, here (link to video on Youtube). For more on Norwegian’s family offerings can be found at www.ncl.com/family.
posts.excerpt: On March 22, 2012, Norwegian Breakaway’s youth and teen spaces were unveiled at an event held in partnership with Conde Nast Traveler. Close to 100 hundred travel partners and media were in attendance, along with Norwegian’s CEO Kevin Sheehan, Executive Vice President of Global Sales, Andy Stuart, and Senior Vice President of Marketing, Maria Miller. [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway’s Name is Set in Place
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway’s Name is Set in Place
posts.content: The team at Meyer Werft have applied the ship’s name, in the form of steel letters, to the aft portion of Norwegian Breakaway!
posts.excerpt: The team at Meyer Werft have applied the ship’s name, in the form of steel letters, to the aft portion of Norwegian Breakaway!

posts.title: Norwegian Breakaway’s First External Blocks Arrive
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Breakaway’s First External Blocks Arrive
posts.content: The first of Norwegian Breakaway’s external blocks of steel have arrived at Meyer Werft. These two blocks were transported 80 miles via the North Sea and up the Ems river from Bremen, Germany before arriving to the shipyard in Papenburg, Germany. Block 33 weighs 700 tons and Block 34 weighs 500 tons, totaling the weight of 141 elephants! Block 33 stretches 130.2 feet wide, the full breadth of the ship.  These are the two first blocks that will be lifted into the building dock to be the foundation of The Waterfront and 678 Ocean Place!
posts.excerpt: The first of Norwegian Breakaway’s external blocks of steel have arrived at Meyer Werft. These two blocks were transported 80 miles via the North Sea and up the Ems river from Bremen, Germany before arriving to the shipyard in Papenburg, Germany. Block 33 weighs 700 tons and Block 34 weighs 500 tons, totaling the weight [...]

posts.title: Norwegian Continues Innovation & Excitement on Norwegian Breakaway
posts.title_plain: Norwegian Continues Innovation & Excitement on Norwegian Breakaway
posts.content:
At a press conference today at Cruise Shipping Miami, Norwegian Cruise Line CEO Kevin Sheehan and Senior Vice President of Marketing Maria Miller presented an exciting, all new design concept that will debut on Norwegian Breakaway to a room filled with cruise media from around the world.

This new concept includes an oceanfront boardwalk lined with shops, restaurants and bars, combined with three expansive, flowing decks of dining, bars, entertainment, gaming and more.  According to Sheehan, The Waterfront and 678 Ocean Place will take cruising to new heights and offer an unparalleled experience with a unique connection to the ocean.

Located on Deck 8, The Waterfront is a revolutionary outdoor experience that adds a whole new dimension to the line’s signature Freestyle Cruising, by offering a number of seaside venues that feature breathtaking views and a sense of connection with the ocean.  The hub of the ship is 678 Ocean Place, a space that uniquely flows, intertwines and connects three decks of daytime and nighttime amusements. There will be a total of 17* dining venues combined on both 678 Ocean Place and The Waterfront, along with 12* bars and lounges.  Norwegian will also introduce a new dining concept on Norwegian Breakaway, Ocean Blu, the line’s first ever all-seafood restaurant, which will include a premium raw bar, along with a separate sushi bar.

“In a recent guest survey, our guests chose a seafood restaurant as the number one type of restaurant they would like on board our ships,” said Sheehan.  “We listened to that feedback when planning the dining on Norwegian Breakaway and will launch Ocean Blu as our newest signature restaurant concept.”

To read more about Ocean Blu and all the restaurants, bars and lounges announced today, click here to read the press release.

This new concept includes an oceanfront boardwalk lined [...]

posts.title: The Haven
posts.title_plain: The Haven
posts.content: These private enclaves at the top of the ships are home to our most luxurious, well-appointed and spacious accommodations offering the utmost in service and elegance. The Haven guests have an array of amenities, including private butler and concierge service, poolside valet, and white table cloth in-suite dining to name a few.
posts.excerpt: These private enclaves at the top of the ships are home to our most luxurious, well-appointed and spacious accommodations offering the utmost in service and elegance. The Haven guests have an array of amenities, including private butler and concierge service, poolside valet, and white table cloth in-suite dining to name a few.

posts.title: Cruise from New York to Bermuda
posts.title_plain: Cruise from New York to Bermuda
posts.content: Norwegian loves the Big Apple! Norwegian has had a long-standing commitment to New York and now we are bringing our newest ship there year-round! In the summer of 2013, the ship will sail to beautiful pink sand beaches of Bermuda. We’ll dock at King’s Wharf for three days, giving you the freedom to explore the beaches, golf courses, restaurants, shops and history at your leisure, and you’ll have three relaxing days at sea to enjoy all the incredible amenities of this world-class ship.

posts.title: Peter Max
posts.title_plain: Peter Max
posts.content: Pop icon and America’s most popular living artist, Peter Max, has been commissioned to paint the signature hull artwork for Norwegian Breakaway. This is the first time Norwegian has asked a well-known artist to paint the hull artwork on one of its ships.
posts.excerpt: Pop icon and America’s most popular living artist, Peter Max, has been commissioned to paint the signature hull artwork for Norwegian Breakaway. This is the first time Norwegian has asked a well-known artist to paint the hull artwork on one of its ships.

posts.title: Building Breakaway
posts.title_plain: Building Breakaway
posts.content: Here you’ll find the latest information and behind-the-scenes looks at the planning, building and preparing that will make these ships the ultimate in Freestyle Cruising. Check back periodically for updates, photos and more from the team at Norwegian and Meyer Werft.

posts.title: Our New Breakaway Class
posts.title_plain: Our New Breakaway Class
posts.content: Norwegian Cruise Line has announced the names of its two new industry leading Freestyle Cruising ships: Norwegian Breakaway, sailing April 2013, and Norwegian Getaway, sailing April 2014. Each of the 144,017 gross ton vessels, the largest passenger cruise ships to be built in Germany, will have approximately 4,000 passenger berths and a rich cabin mix. Check back often for updated information on all things related to Norwegian Breakaway and Norwegian Getaway.

Each of the 144,017 gross ton vessels, the largest passenger cruise ships to be built in Germany, will have approximately 4,000 passenger berths and a rich cabin mix. [...]

posts.title: Staterooms
posts.title_plain: Staterooms
posts.content: The overall design theme for Project Breakaway’s staterooms is “modern boutique hotel meets the sea”. The needs of guests were strongly considered when designing these staterooms. Guests will be greeted with an ambiance that is warm and inviting and has a very contemporary feel with clean, modern lines.

Guests will be greeted with an ambiance that is warm and inviting and has a very contemporary feel with clean, modern lines.

posts.title: Cruising for Names
posts.title_plain: Cruising for Names
posts.content:
Norwegian Breakaway & Norwegian Getaway

Norwegian Cruise Line has selected the winning names: Norwegian Breakaway and Norwegian Getaway.

The names best invoked the feeling that these ships will provide a “break” at sea from the stress of everyday life.

The contest winners are Kimberly Powell of Lafayette, LA, who first submitted Norwegian Breakaway, and Dennis Hultman of Vienna, VA, who first submitted Norwegian Getaway.
